Package com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.impl.util

Class HandlerFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.impl.util.HandlerFactory
  • public class HandlerFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Configures handlers for HTTP requests.

    These handlers correctly configure the fiber (thread-like adaptor for async frameworks like vertx) that the HTTP handler will run on.

    Handlers can accept a combination of parameters: a user ID if the HTTP request requires authentication, some parameters in the URL, and a JSON body deserialized to a specified type. This is determined by the signature of the handler.

    See Also:
    for a full description of how to create new API methods.

      static interface  HandlerFactory.AuthorizedParamHandler<R>
      A method that requires authentication, takes a URL parameter and returns data.
      static interface  HandlerFactory.AuthorizedRequestHandler<T,​R>
      A method that requires authentication, accepts a request and returns data.
      static interface  HandlerFactory.EmptyHandler<R>
      A method that takes no arguments and returns data.
      static interface  HandlerFactory.ParamHandler<R>
      A method that does not require authentication, takes a URL parameter and returns data.
      static interface  HandlerFactory.RequestHandler<T,​R>
      A method that does not require authentication, accepts a request and returns data.

        public static <T,​R> io.vertx.core.Handler<io.vertx.ext.web.RoutingContext> handler​(java.lang.Class<T> classT,

        Creates a handler for a method with the WebResult<R> call(RoutingContext context, String userId, T request) signature.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The request class type.
        R - The response class type.

        classT - The request class.
        internalHandler - The actual method.
        Returns:
